org.conqat.lib.commons.io

Class StreamReaderThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.conqat.lib.commons.io.StreamReaderThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class StreamReaderThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    A thread to drain an input stream. Storing the content is optional. If an exception occurs during draining, the exceptions message is appended to the content and the exception is also made available via getException(). So if the caller wants to ensure that the content is really complete, he not only has to wait for the end of the thread via join, but also check this method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StreamReaderThread

        public StreamReaderThread(java.io.InputStream input)
        Create a new reader that reads the content of this stream in its own thread. => This call is non-blocking.

        This constructor causes the content to be stored.

        Parameters:
        input - Stream to read from. This stream is not automatically closed, but must be closed by the caller (if this is intended).

      • StreamReaderThread

        public StreamReaderThread(java.io.InputStream input,
                          java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Create a new reader that reads the content of this stream in its own thread. => This call is non-blocking.

        This constructor causes the content to be stored.

        Parameters:
        input - Stream to read from. This stream is not automatically closed, but must be closed by the caller (if this is intended).
        charset - Character set to be used to convert the stream into a string.

      • getException

        public java.io.IOException getException()
